intro: Lilium pendulum, commonly known as the hanging lily, is a species of true lily native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Asia. It is characterized by its slender, drooping stems and clusters of fragrant, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves arranged in a spiral pattern. Its bulbous root system is adapted to survive in rocky or well-drained soils. The flowers are often used in traditional medicine and as ornamental plants in gardens.
